name: Hotel Giraffe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 7 nights at the end of June 07 and had a great trip. It was our second visit to New York so having visited a lot of the tourist sights previously we were looking for a relaxing stay in a relaxing hotel. The Hotel Giraffe didn't disappoint.
reviews.title: Quiet oasis in the middle of New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean and nicely decorated. The ipod docking station was a nice touch, as was the turn down service which you would expect from a hotel of this class.
reviews.title: loved the giraffe
Great boutique hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast in the mornings was sufficient for what we wanted with cereal, bagels, fruit and yoghurts. Don't get there too late if you want the pick of the pastries though! We enjoyed the tea and coffee that was always available throughout the day, and of course the cheese and wine. It was just a shame that during the evenings there wasn't much of an atmosphere in the lobby. Although the pianist did try.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooftop bar was a nice way to start an evening. The bar downstairs was a nice way to end it as well!
reviews.title: Perfect accomodation for proposal in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very pleasant and very discreet. Available if you needed their assistance but not over-friendly which suited us Brits!
reviews.title: Very pleased with the Giraffe

reviews.text: I have been staying at Hotel Giraffe for the past 8 years and it only keeps gettting better and better. This hotel is more like your private apartment in the city!
reviews.title: When you want nothing but the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff knows your name and the atmosphere is so calm and relaxing in the heart of the bustling city.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel.

likes.disliked: — Service was good but they need to be happier.

reviews.text: Hotel Giraffe is the city's best kept secret......I will be back!!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

likes.disliked: — Lighting in the lobby in the evening

reviews.title: A Superb Experience
reviews.text: John Perez

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Houston, Texas
reviews.title: Taxi !! To City Hall please - we're getting married !!

likes.disliked: — View over side street - next time would have room on Park Avenue

reviews.title: Midwestern Charm in NYC
reviews.text: I had heard good things from friends about the Hotel Giraffe and its reputation is well earned. It's a little pricey, but they do so much extra for the guests that you feel like they really appreciate your business. Check in was simple. When we arrived there was a complimentary wine and cheese assortment with live music. In the very busy NYC, this was such a relaxing break. The room was very beautifully decorated and extremely comfortable. The breakfast, included in the rate, is another amenity that makes hectic NYC so much easier to manage. The location at 26th and Park can't be beat. I highly recommend this hotel and will gladly return again in the future.

reviews.title: Continue to maintain high standard
reviews.text: This was our fourth stay at this hotel, stretching over a number of years, and we were impressed by how they have consistently kept their high standards. Service is excellent - staff is helpful, pleasant and informed. The hotel is very well maintained, which is often not the case with boutique properties. An inviting, comfortable place to stay!

reviews.title: Hotel Giraffe is a gem!
reviews.text: I'm a New Yorker who was looking for a short getaway in my own city. I found it at the Hotel Giraffe. The location is close to the subway and central to many parts of the city, including Greenwich Village, which I wanted to explore. The hotel room size was ample with nice amenities, including robes and flat screen tvs. I loved the lobby with its comfortable seating; a great location for the complimentary breakfast. I'd like to return in the summer and spend more time at the rooftop seating area, which also looked relaxed and comfortable.

reviews.title: Great Little Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: This is a great little hotel in a non tourist location. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. They offered a breakfast in the lobby that was just right and a wonderful wine and cheese reception at 5 daily. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. It is conveniently located close to the subway and numerous restaurants and shops. There is a wonderful city park (Madison Square Park) just one block to the west that was a great place for our 7 year old daughter to play. We really enjoyed our stay there and wouldn't hesitate to go back.

reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect!
reviews.text: I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough! We chose the hotel to celebrate my birthday and also to spend our first trip to New York. We were looking for something central, but also out of the main tourist areas, and with a certain uniqueness. The hotel was perfect on all counts. We found the staff to be excellent, nothing was too much trouble, and they helped make my birthday very special. The room was gorgeous and comfortable, we had a view all the way down Park Avenue South from our balcony, the cheese and wine was great and we found the location to be perfect - there are several great restaurants nearby - A Voce and Dos Caminos - and a subway stop a couple of minutes walk away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is well located and very friendly.
reviews.title: Stick your neck out and try the Giraffe
Perfect Choice
reviews.text: Between mid-town and Soho/Greenwich Village, the hotel is near several great restaurants within a short walk, and subway stops just a couple of blocks away on Park Avenue.
Breakfast was fresh and basic--fruit and pastries and bagels--which my wife said were authentic New York style.
reviews.title: A great place in the chaos that is NEW YORK CITY!

likes.liked: — The wine and chesse evenings as well as my room. Very, very comfortable!
likes.disliked: — There was only one computer so sometimes there was a bit of a wait to use it.

reviews.text: Our room was quite nice, but we'd suggest avoiding the 12th floor where we stayed, as the outdoor bar goes well past midnight most nights, and there is a meeting room directly adjacent.
reviews.title: New Favorite Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our tv was hard to figure out, but the staff helped us each time we were having problems. There is no business center, but there is a single computer in the lobby available first come first served.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Hotel Giraffe before a cruise in June and loved the hotel. The room was a decent size by NYC standards and the bathroom and amenities were first rate. The continental breakfast buffet was very good, too. The staff was very accommodating. Though our room was not ready when we arrived, the bell man stored our luggage and delivered it as soon as we got our keys. We took a short walk to Madison Square Park and had lunch. It's a great neighborhood.
reviews.title: Charming place and great location!

likes.liked: — Good Location, Nice clean room/bathroom, Excellent staff

reviews.text: My only criticism of the hotel is there was a considerable amount of street noise when the garbage trucks came through around 11pm - midnight. We were on the 4th floor and it's possible that the noise might be less intrusive on a higher floor. I mentioned it to the front desk after the first night and they were sympathetic and offered to re-locate us to a higher floor. We declined because we only had one more night. The noise was still present on the second night but not as bad.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay at this hotel again. I loved the location and loved the room/bathroom. It's an easy walk to Chelsea, Union Square, Soho, Grand Central Station. It's a great alternative to hotels in Midtown/Times Square.
reviews.title: great stay at the giraffe

reviews.text: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite Saturday night 7/7/7. The hotel staff called in advance to find out our arrival time (late morning), and had a room ready when we arrived. Everyone was very nice, the room was clean & functional, well appointed.
reviews.title: very relaxing, great location-nice hotel

likes.disliked: — The fluctuating price NY was expensive this time around.

reviews.text: The stay was excellent & I would return again.
reviews.title: Great base

reviews.text: Just returned from a four night stay with my 16 year old daughter. Booked after reading previous write-ups and was not disappointed. Lovely hotel with absolutely wonderful staff from which nothing is too much trouble from the front desk staff to the lady that cleaned our room everyone was polite and made us feel welcome.
reviews.title: Wonderful boutique hotel
Perfect Hotel!! Perfect Location and Perfect Everything!
reviews.text: The rooms are lovely, we shared a deluxe twin with balcony. Large room with loads of mirrors (just what a sixteen year old needs). Bathroom was well stocked with plenty of excellent products. Complimentary breakfast is good but would say that it would be great if they could provide a cooked breakfast or buffet, but this will in now way stop us from staying there again and I will definitely recommend it to all my friends.
Hotel is in a good area within walking distance of shops and a metro on the doorstep. Definitely a good place to stay and would be more than a 3.5* if they provided a buffet breakfast.
reviews.title: Stayed 4 nights at the Giraffe

likes.disliked: — really odd glass door on bathroom

reviews.text: Awesome time!! Me and my sisters met for the weekend and we loved the location perfect to travel uptown or downtown--walking!!
reviews.title: Hotel Giraffe! Everything I Expected and So Much More!
we will return
reviews.text: The staff was helpful and friendly. The rooms were great, the rooftop was perfect to chill with friends and Barna was a great place to end the night at, dancing or just people watching!! We loved the cleanliness and simpleness of the lobby and how our stay included breakfast daily and nightly wine and cheese, we also loved having coffee and tea and fruits during the day. This Hotel I would highly recommend. We were so glad we didnt stay in the tourist trap of times square yet it was in walking distance as well as union square and tribeca, soho etc. we were able to relax and unwind in our room or the rooftop or lobby when we were not busy cruising the streets of NYC!! Thanks Giraffe, we will be back!!

I was in New York for five days to deliver my son to college. My sister came up from New Orleans so that we could have some fun in the city. The staff at Giraffe--mostly a group of very affable young men--were welcoming and helpful. Our double bedded room was BIG by New York standards, the furnishings were modern by warm, beds comfy and the bathroom very nice-sized with nice toiletries. Loved the bath robes. Really, really loved the fact that there was almost always a little something to drink or snack on in the lobby. Made it feel so comfortable and personal. Just a wonderful, easy place to be in New York.
reviews.title: Giraffe is a perfect New York perch.

likes.liked: — The room and the all-day hosting in the lobby.
likes.disliked: — The fabulous black out shades did not extend all the way to the window edges, so a sliver of like came in to wake me up.

reviews.text: An excellent small hotel - room was lovely and very clean, maid service excellent, very nice breakfast in lobby which we took to rooftop patio, complimentary wine/cheese each late aft., staff were friendly and helpful. top floor is popular for weekend events so place can be busy but if you know this, no problem! handy to clothing shops nearby heading south on 5th ave.
reviews.title: Giraffe a pleasant surprise in NYC

reviews.text: Last weekend my family went for a quick trip to New York City. We were looking for somewhere nice but not too expensive to stay and the Giraffe exceeded all of our expectations. The service from everyone, particularly Jose, was outstanding; always present and eager to help but never intrusive. The rooms were gorgeous with nice amenities and plenty of room for 3 of us with two double beds. I really appreciated the amount of natural light during the day and then the shade that lowered at night to block out all of the lights of the city. It is not a huge room, but it served our purposes very well. The decor was simple and elegant. The beds are a little hard and the pillows were a little soft, but they do provide harder pillows in the closet. Once I used those the bed became very comfortable. The bathroom was also quite spacious for such a small room and I particularly appreciated the cloth they provided to wipe the steam off the mirrors after exiting the shower.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay at the Giraffe

likes.disliked: — bed was a little hard, but still comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I personally enjoyed the lobby area just to sit and read a book or enjoy a cup of coffee. It has plenty of natural light and high ceilings with classic decor and beautiful flower arrangements. It was a great setting for breakfast, afternoon tea and wine and cheese in the evening. The breakfast was your standard breakfast, but the coffee was good and everything was always fresh. Wine and cheese in the evening was a great way to unwind after the day and before going out to dinner. If you are looking for a boutique hotel in New York with a wonderful location and exceptional service, the Giraffe is the place for you!
reviews.title: Consistently Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second time at Hotel Giraffe was the same great experience as the first. We were celebrating a birthday and I had indicated this when I booked the room (on the hotel's site). A bottle of champagne was waiting on ice when we entered our room, compliments of the hotel. And chocolates! The wine in the evenings, breakfast in the morning, and warmth and helpfulness of the staff make up for any price difference above other Manhattan hotels- you just won't find this level of quality any cheaper. We loved the robes and slippers they have hanging in the closet. The staff was super helpful with directions on the subway system, restaurant picks (try Ray's pizza or Porchao just across the intersection), and recommendations for a night out. We will stay here again, without a doubt.
reviews.title: Excllent smaller hotel in New York

likes.disliked: — The bed was a bit firm

reviews.title: Still firing on all Cylinders
reviews.text: This was our fifth (or sixth?) stay at the Giraffe, our favorite NYC hotel.

reviews.title: My favorite boutique hotel
reviews.text: Not a single thing to complain about. Hard to believe this is NYC. Very friendly and helpful staff from the doorman to the front desk to the breakfast bar.

reviews.title: Wonderful find in NYC!
reviews.text: Even the lowest price standard queen is a lovely room, which is what we book. This time, we were upgraded to a suite (without asking) and it was superb, elegant, roomy,and bright.

reviews.title: Just lovely
reviews.text: If there are better boutique hotels in NY at this price, I'd be surprised.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!
reviews.text: I am in New York about once a month. I tried several other hotels, but this is my favorite. It is very conveniently located for walking or the subway. The staff is pleasant and helpful. Rooms are very clean, with very comfortable beds, and the lobby continental breakfast is convenient on busy mornings or if you want to just relax with a paper or a view of Park Avenue out the window. It's also just about a block away from Madison Square Park, and there are many excellent restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Giraffe this past weekend, it was a combination Birthday/Anniversary celebration. I noted that when I made the reservation, but unlike many of the other guests, we were not greeted with wine or chocolate in our room. I know that is a courtesy, but if you do it for one guest, you should really do it for all guests. The hotel is charming and as another reviewer added not a cookie cutter, chain hotel. We especially liked the complimentary wine and cheese evening reception. On Saturday we went to a 2:00 show and then checked into the hotel, it was so nice to have a few glasses of wine and a snack before heading off to a late dinner. The only thing disappointing was there wasn't a piano player when we were there. Unless he/she came after we had left.
reviews.title: Nice

likes.liked: — Large room, clean, rooftop bar, wine & cheese reception
likes.disliked: — Slow elevators, beds weren't too comfy.

reviews.text: Anyway, the rooms are spacious and clean. I was pleasantly surprised that our room had a balcony overlooking the city. It was very romantic and beautiful. Of course the traffic was loud at night, but I have learned from experience to always travel with a fan for some "white noise". So, it wasn't too bothersome. The beds weren't very comfortable, but I don't think that's uncommon in hotels, at least from my perspective. I think the decor could be kicked up a notch, but it was above average nonetheless.
reviews.title: Whats all the hype about?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The continental breakfast was nice, but nothing fancy. The coffee was weak and the "cappuccino/espresso" machine was like something out of a convenience store and it either wasn't working well or just wasn't tasty. It was also very crowded and difficult to find a seat to eat in the morning, this was a little annoying, but we got over it.
reviews.title: Giraffe is Amazing

reviews.text: The staff was friendly and helpful. They held our bags and our car until after checkout so we could stay in the city longer, so that was nice.
reviews.title: A mixed bag and a nice try
Great rooms at a great price
reviews.text: The one thing that was really great about the hotel was the rooftop bar. My husband and I headed up there after dinner to have a drink and it was a quaint/romantic place to relax before going back to our room.

reviews.title: Big service in a small hotel - Hotel Giraffe
reviews.text: Clean room - check. Friendly service - check. Great location - check. This hotel isn't imposing like some of the big ones in the city, but it has all you need for an enjoyable adult stay. Check in is easy, and the staff will take care of your needs.

reviews.title: The Clear Favorite
reviews.text: The hotel includes the basics - a nice, small lobby with nice views out the window as you eat your complimentary breakfast, and a cool rooftop garden to enjoy a drink or cigar.

reviews.title: Dependable Giraffe Again!
reviews.text: Of course, the location is nice - a great mix of residential, office and retail, and you can get anywhere in the city quickly via subway or cab. For a couple enjoying the city, it's perfect.

reviews.title: The Giraffe is terrific!
reviews.text: We stayed here due to a discount for a friends wedding, and after staying at 4-5 other hotels on previous trips I have to say, I'll never stay any where else. The rooms are a good size and well equipped, the breakfast was perfect, and the wine and cheese a great way to start the evening. Roof Bar was also a cozy place to grab after dinner drinks. There is good food near by with Blue Smoke right around the corner for BBQ or Haru for sushi, the park bar a short walk away for reasonably priced drinks.

reviews.title: Delightful Hotel Giraffe
reviews.text: This was our 3rd visit to the Giraffe. You can count on good service, clean moderately sized rooms with some upgrades, a daily continental breakfast and a daily wine and cheese reception in the large main lobby area (except Sunday). You are a two minute walk to a subway station on the green line so you can be in upper midtown/Central Park or south to the tip of Manhattan with a 10-15 minute subway ride max. It is a nice area for walking - Gramercy Park, Madison Square Park are very close (3-5 minutes) and Union Square is a 10-15 minute walk and lots of modestly priced restaurants within walking distance. There is a nightclub next door Barna (which also has a restaurant) - more for the younger crowd 20's and 30's which can be noisy in the evenings from the music, best to request a room higher up in the building if possible to escape the nightclub noise and to a lesser extent street level noise from traffic if either would be of concern. You won't be disappointed if you book this hotel - bear in mind it is a smaller "boutique" hotel so won't have the trappings of a big hotel like a Hilton etc. if that is what you are looking for.

reviews.title: best hotel in this neighborhood!
reviews.text: Absolutely the best hotel in this area of NYC. I think I've stayed in every other hotel from Soho to 34th st. and the Hotel Giraffe was by far the best. The staff is so friendly and helpful, the rooms well appointed and clean, a very, VERY good deal for NYC.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For our future trips into NYC, we will always stay at this stylish, beautiful and classy hotel. Compared to other Manhatatn hotels, with their cramped, tired rooms, ridiculous prices and stuffy staff, the Hotel Giraffe soars above the mundane to offer a very special experience. The rooms are decorated with soothing and sophisticated colors and every conveniece was at our fingertips -- from an umbrella for a rainy day to a sound and light-blocking window shade that was controlled by a switch next to the bed. This is a most beautifully designed hotel with impeccable interiors, spacious rooms, lovely bathrooms and a professional and courteous staff. Well done!!
reviews.title: Beauty and Class at the Hotel Giraffe

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights in a suite at the Giraffe last week. The room was absolutely wonderful. So clean and beautifully furnished. It was so quiet and peaceful. This was our 3rd stay at this hotel. As usual we enjoyed the breakfasts and afternoon wine and cheese. We cannot wait to go back to this hotel. We always say that we should try another hotel but why mess with a great thing!
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay at the Giraffe

reviews.text: We stayed only one night but very much enjoyed our comfortable, pleasurable, tastefully appointed room. Regretted not having the time to fully take advantage of the wine and cheese hour--but did grab a cracker and cheese in passing. The breakfast buffet was also quite nice. Would definitely come again and highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Comfortable, pleasurable stay

reviews.text: My daughter attends NYU so we decided it would be nice to take in a play last weekend and stay in a Boutique Hotel and treat ourselves. We wanted to escape the crowds and craziness of NYC and could not have found a better choice than the Hotel Giraffe!
reviews.title: like Home away from home!!!

likes.liked: — large room and space and Comfort

reviews.text: My husband and I had previously had a wonderful stay at Hotel Giraffe in 2006 and so when I planned to take my mother for a birthday trip to NYC I didnt hesitate to book into the Hotel Giraffe again.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel...again

reviews.text: We had a Exec double which was perfect as it had 2 double beds and the room had plenty of space and a lovely bathroom. The beds were really comfortable.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

likes.liked: — Rooms, breakfast and wine in the evening

reviews.text: The hotel is spotlessly clean in all areas.
reviews.title: Disappointing and over priced

reviews.text: The hotel is lovely as it is quite small and personal but the service is never intrusive. The breakfast served in the lobby is lovely and the perfect start to a day sightseeing in NYC.
reviews.title: Down with chain hotels, try the Hotel Giraffe instead

likes.disliked: — A bit noisy in the hall outside our door.

reviews.text: I think my favourite thing about the hotel is how relaxed and calm it is - sometimes New York gets quite hectic and it really did feel nice to come back to the tranquil peace of the hotel giraffe to chill out.
reviews.title: Great location
A Great Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed for a week and found the hotel accomadation spacious and very clean. Prices were equivalent to other hotels in the district and unusually Breakfast was included.

reviews.title: Hotel Giraffe: Outstanding!
reviews.text: Quiet at night and therefore getting sleep wasn't a problem either.

reviews.title: Doesn't deserve such a high review
reviews.text: Within walking distance of the Empire state, Flatiron and Macy's and there's a Metro station at the end of the block.

reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Good Location
reviews.text: Great location and friendly staff. We were very happy with our choice of hotel.

reviews.title: Great stay at Hotel Giraffe
reviews.text: Hotel Giraffe proved to be an oasis in the NYC desert of overpriced, over-rated, cookie-cutter hotels and cut-rate fleabags. We spent three nights and couldn't find a thing to complain about. Doormen, desk staff, housekeeping staff were on the ball, courteous, attentive and actually seemed to enjoy what they were doing. King-bed room was spacious, well-appointed, clean and comfortable. Location is a short 10- to 15-minute walk to Union Square, a shorter walk to Madison Square Park (and the Shake Shack's delicious burgers, fries and milkshakes) and convenient to uptown and downtown subways. Inexpensive? No. Worth the price? Definitely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was everything we were looking for. We would definitely stay here again and have recommended it to all of our friends already!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel Giraffe

likes.liked: — Comfy room, great staff, breakfast, location

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Giraffe in Sept 08 as our last fling before our baby arrives, and had a fantastic time. The room itself was spacious and had a cute balcony to watch the world go by. The bed was comfy with a selection of pillows, the bathroom was clean and well stocked. It was the little touches that made it special though - robes and slippers, luxurious toiletries, complimentary bottles of water, and an iHome dock so we could play our own music. We were on the 11th floor which is definitely recommended as the street noise can get loud.
reviews.title: Wow, What a Great Escape!
Wonderful
reviews.text: This was our second visit to the Giraffe, and we thorougly enjoyed our stay. In fact, I had booked family as well, and everyone loved their experience. I am well traveled, and find the Giraffe very accommodating in every way. Yes, our room wasn't ready prior to 3, but keep in mind on the other end, checkout is at 1 pm. One great advantage is the comfortable lobby where you can have complimentary breakfast in the morning, cappuccino & cookies throughout the day, and at 5 pm, cheese, crackers and wine. The lobby in very condusive to talking and meeting friends in the city. The rooms are very comfortable and have many ammenities. The only drawback, is there is noise from the street, which you find in most NYC hotels. The doorman and lobby staff were wonderful, and when it was pouring rain, they were sure to flag a cab for us. Try the Giraffe, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.title: A great place to stay, we will be back.
reviews.text: Hotel Giraffe was a great base for our one week stay in the city, it is a perfect location for both uptown and downtown. And there is a subway station only 2 blocks away (5 mins walk max)

reviews.title: Average Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: When booking I asked for a high floor and this was granted, I would recommend trying to get a high room in any New York hotel as street noise is very loud.

reviews.title: Memorable Stay
reviews.text: The rooms are a good size with lots of hanging and drawer space a massive bed and a flat sreen t.v. You get a little balcony to look out onto the city, you also get lots of nice little things to like bottled water, Bath robes and slippers but above all the room is spotlesly clean.

reviews.title: Doesn't live up to the hype
reviews.text: The hotels door staff and concierge staff do a great job, always willing to help with any needs from ice for the room,getting you a taxi to reserving you seats at manhattans top restaurants. nothing was a problem for them and they seemed genuinely happy to help.

description: Hotel Giraffe's elegant public spaces and award winning guestrooms create an immediate sense of effortless luxury and unparalleled comfort. Guests enjoy free WiFi and complimentary refreshments including the Library Hotel Collection's signature Continental Breakfast Buffet each morning and wine & cheese receptions every evening from 5PM-8PM, and coffee, tea, cookies and fruit around the clock served in the Grand Lobby. You can also customize your room to suit your needs with special features offered such as coffee/tea making facilities, featherbed mattress toppers or memory foam pillows to name just a few options. If we don't have the date, room or location you need, try our sister hotels, the Casablanca, Library Hotel or the Hotel Elysee all ranking among the top hotels in NYC by members of TripAdvisor.
